Package com.evanv.taskapp.logic

Class Optimizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.evanv.taskapp.logic.Optimizer
  • public class Optimizer
extends java.lang.Object
    The holy grail. A class that calculates a (locally) optimal schedule for task completion dependent on other tasks, their prerequisites, and events.
    Author:
    Evan Voogd

      Constructors

    • Method Detail

      • findTrueEndDate

        private org.threeten.bp.LocalDate findTrueEndDate​(Task t)
        Finds the date that is the earlier of A) the earliest current do date for a child Task, or B) the actual due date for the given Task, as scheduling later than the earlier of these dates would create problems.
        Parameters:
        t - The task to find the true end date for
        Returns:
        The latest date this task should be rescheduled for

      • findTrueEarlyDate

        private org.threeten.bp.LocalDate findTrueEarlyDate​(Task t)
        Finds the date that is the later of A) the earliest current do date for a parent Task, or B) the actual earliest completion date for the given Task, as scheduling earlier than the later of these dates would create problems.
        Parameters:
        t - The task to find the true early date for
        Returns:
        The earliest date this task should be rescheduled for

      • schedule

        private void schedule​(Task t,
                      int index,
                      org.threeten.bp.LocalDate startDate,
                      java.util.List<java.util.List<Task>> taskSchedule,
                      int[] time)
        Schedules task for the date index days past startDate.
        Parameters:
        t - The task to be scheduled
        index - How many days past startDate to be scheduled
        startDate - The Date representing taskSchedule[0]
        taskSchedule - ArrayList where taskSchedule[i] is a list of tasks scheduled for i days past the start date
        time - Array of ints where time[i] is the number of minutes scheduled for i days past

      • remove

        private void remove​(Task t,
                    int index,
                    java.util.List<java.util.List<Task>> taskSchedule,
                    int[] time)
        Removes task from taskSchedule/time for the given index.
        Parameters:
        t - The task to be removed
        index - Index into taskSchedule where task is located
        taskSchedule - ArrayList where taskSchedule[i] is a list of tasks scheduled for i days past the start date
        time - Array of ints where time[i] is the number of minutes scheduled for i days past the start date

      • Optimize

        public java.util.ArrayList<Task> Optimize​(java.util.List<Task> tasks,
                                          java.util.List<java.util.List<Task>> taskSchedule,
                                          java.util.List<java.util.List<Event>> eventSchedule,
                                          org.threeten.bp.LocalDate startDate,
                                          int todayTime)
        Optimally schedules the given tasks
        Parameters:
        tasks - A list of Tasks to be scheduled
        taskSchedule - A list of lists of tasks. taskSchedule[i] refers to the list of tasks scheduled for i days past the current day.
        eventSchedule - A list of lists of events. eventSchedule[i] refers to the list of events occurring i days past the current day
        startDate - The current date
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of tasks whose dates were changed.

      • calculateTotalTime

        public static int calculateTotalTime​(int day,
                                     java.util.List<java.util.List<Event>> eventSchedule)
        Calculates the total event time for a specific day
        Parameters:
        day - What day to calculate
        eventSchedule - Schedule of events where ith element is list of elements scheduled for i days past today.
        Returns:
        Total event time for a specific day

      • getStartEndMinutes

        private static kotlin.Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> getStartEndMinutes​(Event e)
        Get a pair representing the timespan of the event. First item is how many minutes past midnight this event starts, and the second item is how many minutes past midnight this event ends.
        Parameters:
        e - The event to get the timespan of
        Returns:
        A pair of ints representing the timespan of the event.

      • initialAssignment

        private void initialAssignment​(java.util.PriorityQueue<Task> pq,
                               org.threeten.bp.LocalDate startDate,
                               java.util.List<java.util.List<Task>> taskSchedule,
                               int[] time)
        First run of scheduling. Basically assigns a task to the date between it's earliest completion date and it's due date with the lowest current commitment.
        Parameters:
        pq - PriorityQueue of all tasks in the data structure
        startDate - Today's date
        taskSchedule - Schedule to place tasks in
        time - Array where ith entry is the time commitment in minutes i days past today

      • update

        private boolean update​(java.util.List<Task> tasks,
                       org.threeten.bp.LocalDate startDate,
                       java.util.List<java.util.List<Task>> taskSchedule,
                       int[] time)
        Finds local minimum for time variance by attempting to A) move tasks into lesser scheduled days and B) swap with tasks to decrease variance. Iterative algorithm that isn't extremely computationally efficient - but produces extremely good results and performance in testing. This is a single iteration.
        Parameters:
        tasks - List of tasks in internal data structures
        startDate - Today's date
        taskSchedule - Schedule of tasks: tS[i] is list of tasks scheduled for i days past today
        time - Array of time commitments, where time[i] is for i days past today's date
        Returns:
        true if the update moved a task, false if converged

      • moveDate

        private boolean moveDate​(int[] time,
                         int otherDateIndex,
                         Task t,
                         org.threeten.bp.LocalDate startDate,
                         java.util.List<java.util.List<Task>> taskSchedule)
        See if moving task from doDate to otherDate decreases variance
        Parameters:
        time - Array of time commitments, where time[i] is for i days past today's date
        otherDateIndex - Date to see if swapping to decreases variance
        t - Task to attempt to move
        startDate - Today's date
        taskSchedule - Schedule of tasks: tS[i] is list of tasks scheduled for i days past today
        Returns:
        true if task was moved, false if not

      • swapTasks

        private boolean swapTasks​(Task t1,
                          Task t2,
                          int[] time,
                          org.threeten.bp.LocalDate startDate,
                          java.util.List<java.util.List<Task>> taskSchedule)
        See if swapping two tasks decreases variance
        Parameters:
        t1 - First task to attempt swap on
        t2 - Second task to attempt swap on
        time - Array of time commitments, where time[i] is for i days past today's date
        startDate - Today's date
        taskSchedule - Schedule of tasks: tS[i] is list of tasks scheduled for i days past today
        Returns:
        true if tasks were swapped, false otherwise
